groups.name: Bright objects in the sky (during day)

easy.notes: Easy groups: (1) items worn on feet (socks, shoes, slippers, boots); (2) day-sky items (sun, cloud, rainbow, kite) with a simple daytime theme; (3) basic school supplies; (4) common breakfast foods. Near-miss temptation: 'glue' might seem like a desk item but better fit is classroom supplies; 'crayon' would fit classroom but not used here to keep exact four.

groups.name: Words that form new words with -er

medium.notes: Medium groups: (1) -er words that form another word with -er suffix (painter, teacher, player, driver). (2) Animals sharing habitat; avoid similar-looking but unrelated animals. (3) Pairs: items typically used in pairs. (4) Kitchen tools for mixing. Near-miss temptation: 'fork' could be in kitchen items, but itâ€™s not in this group to keep clear four; 'ladle' would also be possible but not included to preserve uniqueness.

groups.name: Words that become another word when you add re-
Things that travel in a straight line
Objects found in a pencil-case that are not writing tools

hard.notes: Hard groups: (1) Rhymes with color names; tricky because 'orange' has few perfect rhymes but fits as a color word. (2) Words that gain new meaning with re- prefix; distinguishing true duplicates from false friends is key. (3) Straight-line travel items; ensure items clearly travel in straight lines in everyday use. (4) Non-writing tools found in pencil cases. Near-miss temptation: 'crayon' could be in pencil-case group, but 'glue' is clearly non-writing, while 'eraser' is a common non-writing tool; ensure distinct definitions prevent overlap.
